post.body: It made it into my delicious bookmarks nonetheless when you first posted it. And btw... http://bit.ly/1N1aR5 ;-)
Reminds me of similar arrangement with EMI/Capitol Records building a few years back: http://bit.ly/wgs
Lots of great ones to choose from, but this one hits all the high notes: business, creativity & social change http://bit.ly/9vFI
You have been doing such a great talent wrangling job. Thank you!
Those "top secret YYZ goog hq photos" were a great setup for a rick-roll, you know. Missed opportunity there ;-)
@garyvee always spits into his beloved Jets bucket. Make sure to take it away from him before he goes on stage ;-)
I'm switching back the other way. Let me know how it works for you.
The unfortunate ambassador.
ping.fm? openID? Tell me more tomorrow pm.
aww man, sorry I missed that! Lemme know for next time tho...
maybe you could crowdsource your paper? ;-)
somewhat on that subject, here's a great link from @valdiskrebs http://is.gd/8G68
...and like quantum physics, you can only know its current position or its current trajectory, but not both ;-)
judging by his trajectory, he's an old hand at $skf and $smn ;-)
I would **love** that recipe pls.
Highly recommend a quick lap up to the arctic cirle and back if you have time. Saw the best aurora borealis of my life there.
reminds me of your "lashing 2 rocks together" comment last summer wrt AOL/Yahoo
Love that! Savannah for sure. More like "ideaspace" to encourage brainstorming. Perpetual mini movable barcamp. #tsTO
Lemme guess... a 10x leveraged financials/materials ETF?
re: trade shows: email/skype/phone is great to establish contact. But trade show/in person is where you close the deal, imo.
my .PST is at 1.9 Gigs and counting. Every time I fire up Outlook I hear Clint Eastwood say "Do you feel lucky? Do ya punk?"
Agreed. I often find myself explaining & testifying about the awesomeness of #TorCamp to my personal and professional acquaintances
Tanker storage is the polar opposite of this piece from the ever insightful @pkedrosky from last summer (http://bit.ly/A0sS)
We really missed you, but your swarmth was definitely there in spirit.
We are happy to provide a steady stream of awesome government-subsidized music artists for your consumption.
That's great. Now all we need is @fakeberniemadoff to come spoil the party. Oh, wait...
I can bring my laptop and mobile broadband card if that helps #hohoto
YES... was just thinking about how to pipe some of my fave RSS reads into Twitter and have them show up there.
How much longer will ppl show up to conferences expecting the organizers to provide wifi? Mobile broadband is cheap now.
My favourite line in those cases: "I realize I have not done a good job communicating my expectations with respect to...x" ;-)
Will be doing that over xmas. It's a solid day if you have all the install disks, but well worth it. Colonic irrigation for your pc.
How's your Windows reformatting going? I've been the victim of incessant jokes from my Mac-using friends for the last 2 days ;-)
@jaygoldman I should be going to sleep, but I'm coked up on Neo Citran and reinstalling Windows XP. (insert witty retort here)
YES! As a consultant/entrepreneur, I have never felt better about life/biz/the future. It's a great time to be alive.
Geez, that was dark, even for a nerdy faux-stat joke. Safe travels!
Re:jinx, there's 29k departures/day in US & 1 accident per 450k. Last was on the 23rd in Denver. So ur good for another 2 weeks ;-)
Tak så mycket for the kind wishes, old friend! Look forward to seeing you all soon.
Say hi to the nicoya peninsula for me, will ya? Take a walk down Cabo Blanco while you're there; well worth it (http://bit.ly/15hFW)
Surely you're not trying to solve this problem in 140 characters or less, are you? ;-)
I used that one last time this happened... thanks for the tip! Will be using it again, no doubt.
Thank you very much for that. Sadly, this is not my first time recovering an oversized/busted PST file. 2Gb? I mean, come ON!
Yeah, mostly using web services now, but still need offline email and BB sync. I should get some wisdom from #tsTO roadwarriors.
I predict a slew of sh*tty copycat apps will follow (pun intended)
safe travels, my friend.
Yes, the content creator's dilemma! Somewhat akin to a high school relationship: being loved but not respected... or something.
Ces discussions ne mènent à rien et tu le sais bien / These discussions are pointless to engage in and you know it.
@ricksanchezcnn why not look @ conversations/connections/social change that Twitter enables rather than "weirdest" stories? Ugh.
I conclude that X tweets higher-value info, hence the # of highly followed followers. != "smart net weaving", wouldnt you say?
Listened to 22 consecutive TED audio talks on the drive from Toronto to DC. Head exploding, but deeply inspired.
Moderating a panel later today as part of the Mobile Experience Innovation Centre launch. Come join us! http://meic.eventbrite.com/ #meic
RT @valdiskrebs: Happy to see this... "Dynamic spread of happiness in a large social network" -- http://is.gd/amt3 :-D
Quote of the day goes to Duceppe: "If my grandma had wheels, she'd be a tractor."
the podium is getting plugged in
RT @valdiskrebs: In times of change learners inherit the earth-- Eric Hoffer </how true>
TED (of TED talks) appears to be buying adwords for "TED". Why?
Buying a netbook and looking 4 advice from roadwarriors on syncing docs/email/BlackBerry. I have a broadband dongle but offline email a must
Cohesive Social Scene #tsTO
A place that combines tech, art/design, community and $$ for social good. I often have 1 or 2 out of the 4 and prefer to shop locally #tsTO
Great job on the vid @ryancoleman! PRT @tpurves: social media for non-profits; case study right here http://tinyurl.com/4vrr7v #hohoto
...and that's no joke RT @jemimakiss: George Bush is an anagram of Shoe Bugger... (Thanks @fellowcreative)
So wonderful to connect at #hohoTo. "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world." Thank you all.
It's 9am and my niece and nephew (4 & 2 yrs old) are running around the house, wired on Lindor chocolates. Too cute!
Ugh. Outlook.pst reached 2 Gb, crashed and locked me out of my mail/contacts/appts. Had budgeted a WinXP reinstall tmw anyway. Le sigh.
Natural gas field in Algeria sequesters 800kT of carbon/yr. Useful primer on capture/sequestration (http://bit.ly/XaLC)
